{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3740520,"name":"Philip","username":"philip124816","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/b782af/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-09-16T14:54:35.451Z","cooked":"

Does anyone have experience with both the crimper AndyMark sells vs the one Powerwerx sells? We are trying to figure out which tool we want.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-09-16T14:54:35.451Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":255,"readers_count":254,"score":116.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":506340,"topic_slug":"andymark-powerpole-crimper-vs-powerwerx-tricrimp","display_username":"Philip","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57796,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/andymark-powerpole-crimper-vs-powerwerx-tricrimp/506340/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3740525,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-16T15:04:25.767Z","cooked":"

Having used both, they’re functionally identical. Just get whichever is cheaper (looks like AndyMark currently).

I’m not 100% but I think the Powerwerx is a white-label product made by IWISS/iCrimp. The tools look identical.

Also available on Amazon under the iCrimp brand (an IWISS brand) for cheaper

amazon.com

iCrimp Wire Crimping Tool for 15, 30 and 45 Amp Contacts DC Power Connector...

iCrimp Wire Crimping Tool for 15, 30 and 45 Amp Contacts DC Power Connector Modular Power Connector Kit: Amazon.com: Tools & Home Improvement

$27.99

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-09-16T17:50:02.463Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":209,"readers_count":208,"score":66.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":506340,"topic_slug":"andymark-powerpole-crimper-vs-powerwerx-tricrimp","display_username":"Ryan Reed","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/iCrimp-Crimping-Contacts-Connector-Modular/dp/B01MSQPTDS","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Amazon.com","clicks":7}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66264,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/andymark-powerpole-crimper-vs-powerwerx-tricrimp/506340/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3740641,"name":"Chris Herzog","username":"zog","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zog/{size}/266762_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-16T18:20:25.213Z","cooked":"

Looks pretty similar to me - right down to the changeable jaws. I’ve got a set of other jaws for it for RG connectors (which nowadays would be great if the Smithsonian or another museum needed RG connectors crimped on) and a few others as well - it’s a pretty solid crimper if it’s the same as what Powerwerx is selling..

Incorrect, the Powerwerx was much better than the IWISS/iCrimp circa 2019.

However, the Anderson crimps are physically massive, so “better” isn’t as critically important as on a smaller part.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-09-16T19:07:26.051Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":150,"readers_count":149,"score":65.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":506340,"topic_slug":"andymark-powerpole-crimper-vs-powerwerx-tricrimp","display_username":"s-neff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":66264,"username":"Ryan_Reed","name":"Ryan Reed","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_reed/{size}/268514_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28019,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/andymark-powerpole-crimper-vs-powerwerx-tricrimp/506340/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3741300,"name":"Chris Herzog","username":"zog","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zog/{size}/266762_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-17T16:21:40.828Z","cooked":"
s-neff:

Incorrect, the Powerwerx was much better than the IWISS/iCrimp circa 2019

Hmmm, might not we worth the risk then.

I’m of the mind that I’d gladly light the $20 I saved (or whatever it was) literally on fire when I’ve made a tool choice that saved money but didn’t work well if it would just make things work better. I know, it’s a statement but needs to be parsed or diagrammed but I hope folks get my point…

We all know the Powerwerx crimper rocks. I have a dozen or so crimpers that I’ve bought for various things in search of the “perfect” crimper and hate them so I can feel people’s pain.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-09-17T16:21:40.828Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":113,"readers_count":112,"score":37.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":506340,"topic_slug":"andymark-powerpole-crimper-vs-powerwerx-tricrimp","display_username":"Chris Herzog","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":40142,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Doin' robot stuff... [ FRC 2151 + 3061 | Ri3D Redux '23 | RIP 4292 & 4241 ]"},"post_url":"/t/andymark-powerpole-crimper-vs-powerwerx-tricrimp/506340/6","custom_user_title":"Doin' robot stuff... [ FRC 2151 + 3061 | Ri3D Redux '23 | RIP 4292 & 4241 ]","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3741657,"name":"Ryan Reed","username":"Ryan_Reed","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_reed/{size}/268514_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-18T01:18:41.311Z","cooked":"

Had the IWISS AP11 at home, Powerwerx Tricrimp in the pit. I have included photos for comparison of the two tools using the same wire and contacts.

IMG_53171920×2560 394 KB

Left was 0.174” wide and 0.130” tall, right was 0.170” wide and 0.127” tall. Looks like a bigger difference in the photos but I think that’s just lighting and angle. Both are under Anderson’s spec for maximum crimp barrel dimensions (no minimum given).

Spoiler reveals which tool is right vs left so you can judge without bias: Left is Powerwerx TRIcrimp, right is IWISS AP11.

Photos of both tools:

IMG_53161920×2560 307 KB

IMG_53151920×2560 358 KB

Jaws look similar, I think the TRIcrimp may be a little sharper, but with 10AWG it doesn’t even touch the contact so I’m not sure that matters. For smaller wire it might make a difference.

IMG_53191920×2560 154 KB

IMG_53201920×2560 174 KB

IMG_53211920×2560 264 KB

The TRIcrimp positioner held the contact further in the crimper, but I think that is just from the wear on the positioner. I think it’s supposed to stop it at the wire stop feature on the contact, but it goes a little further in.

In conclusion, I think the Powerwerx Tricrimp may have slightly nicer jaws but I don’t think its enough of a difference to matter.

Sweet, glad they fixed their stuff since the last time I tried them. Thanks for the detailed comparison!
